About

I'm Ian - also known as SanCoca online. Software engineer, game dev, bunny rescuer, Dutch-Australian based in Melbourne. I build things, bake things, fix things, and get stuff done.

I built Katana, a website builder, from scratch. My own site runs on it. When I'm not coding, I'm baking cinnamon scrolls, Dutch Danish (apple, cinnamon, raisins, almond, lemon icing), or pepernoten. I also do voice acting, because why not do everything?

Make, Admire, Talk, Eat, Build, Test, Lift, Haul - I get it DONE.

Dev Side

Software engineering, AI agents, game development, technical deep-dives. Built Katana from the ground up. Always shipping.

Life Side

Baking, bunny rescue, voice acting, crafts, and whatever else I'm into. The stuff that keeps me human.

Keep the tradition alive!

That's a Fijian palm leaf bag. Handwoven, practical, and way cooler than a plastic bag. Super handy, works hard, gets stuff done. Sound familiar?

How I work

Direct. No-nonsense. I'd rather ship something good today than talk about shipping something perfect next quarter. If you want meetings about meetings, I'm the wrong person. If you want stuff done - let's go.

Get in touch

Find me online as SanCoca or reach out at ian@ianhogers.com.

Same person, different modes. Pick your side, or read both.
